_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES



BHJ USA, Inc. We're a full service provider/processor supplying a broad spectrum of species specific proteins including beef, pork, organic and natural chicken, turkey, duck, salmon and white fish blends, formulated to client specifications, grind requirements, and delivered either frozen or in a fresh bulk pump ready form. Ammonia is used as a refrigerant to maintain freezing temperatures in the various stages of the process. The refrigeration system is a closed loop system, meaning the ammonia is continually reused.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY



It is the policy of BHJ USA, Inc. to conduct business in a manner that is safe to the employees, the community, and the environment. The company's officers, managers, and supervisors are accountable to carry out the policies of the company relevant to the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous materials. Protein, Inc. has made a determined effort to develop a plan to prevent releases of extremely hazardous substances. Procedures to assist in the prevention of extremely hazardous material releases are set forth in EPA's Risk Management Program. In the event of a release, the Emergency Response Plan will be the guidance for responding to, containing and reporting such releases.  The Response Plan includes an incident command system for decision making authority for each stage of a release situation.  The company will coordinate with public responders and emergency services in ensuring safety of the public.



RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



BHJ USA, Inc. has set forth in its policies the importance of operating safely.  The company has aggressively developed programs, policies and materials requirements to minimize the possibility of releases. These programs include compliance with appropriate OSHA and EPA regulations and sound safety practices. Stringent material and contractor requirements have been developed to assure that mater

ials and work conform to recognized standards. Training for employees is conducted to maintain a high level awareness when working with hazardous materials.



As part of the Prevention Program, Protein, Inc. has developed a method to evaluate the Risk Management Program. This method includes periodic evaluation of the Program utilizing a Process Hazard Analysis, Mechanical Integrity Inspections, and Compliance Audits.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no RMP reportable accidents within the past five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



Preparations for an emergency including, but not limited to: Fire, Release of hazardous chemicals including ammonia, Bomb Threat, Inclement weather, Civil Disorder, Hostile labor, Flood, Loss of water, Loss of electricity, Terrorist activities, Disruptions due to governmental inspections,  which may occur at this plant. Set-up an adequate chain of command during an emergency. Minimize the impact of an emergency on employee health and safety. Minimize the impact of an emergency on our neighbors and the environment. Follow-up emergency procedures. Our Program is coordinated with the Logansport Fire Department. 



SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS



Future changes to improve release prevention include: improved maintenance procedures, periodically; add new technology as it becomes available; and continued training of plant and response personnel. Our facility is constantly striving to "Lead the Field" in industrial safety. Our goal is and has been to be a responsible corporate citizen, protecting people and the environment. In the last 12 months our Program has undergone an extensive re-write. Our programs will continue to be reviewed (On a 18 month cycle) and updated as necessary.
